RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 86. Claiming Purse 13500. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 3 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 3 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $8,000, allowed 2 lbs. British Columbi a Bred Claiming Price $12,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIZ VICIOUS vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backside and through the final turn, drifted into the two path entering the lane, and inched clear late to prove best. LAUGH WITH ME away alertly and tracked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, eased off the rail in the run to the final turn, mounted a three wide bid through the turn, and closed willingly four wide in deep stretch to get up for the place. BLACK METAL broke sharply and dueled for the lead one out from the rail entering the first turn, forced the pace two wide in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, but was outfinished in deep stretch while racing two out from the rail. PARKER POINT away well and stalked the early leaders while saving ground at the rail in the run down the backside, rallied smartly from along the inside through the final turn, and finished with interest from along the rail in the drive. STAR ENTRY settled at the back of a compact field while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide through the final turn, but failed to make a late impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Laugh With Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked rail, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Star Entry
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Parker Point
ENTRY.OWNER: Musgrove Donald H and Johnson Lyle
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked inside, rallied rail, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz Vicious
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Black Metal
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 91. Claiming Purse 15000. (PLUS UP TO $7,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD CLAIMING PRICE $16,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 3 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 3 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12 ,500 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STAY FANTASTIC away alertly and raced to a narrow advantage from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside and through the final turn from the inside of SHOTGUN RIDER, and battled gamely from the inside of that rival through the lane to prevail. SHOTGUN RIDER broke sharply and pressed the pace from the outside of STAY FANTASTIC entering the stretch the first time, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backside and through the final turn from the outside of that foe, and just missed following a stretch long battle. FAMILY BIZ stalked the early pace into the stretch the first time at the back of a compact field, continued with a wide trip in the run down the backside, rallied four wide into the final turn, and finished willingly six wide in the drive to get up for a share. FORT LANGLEY away well and tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and closed three wide in the drive but was outfinished late. OSTRACIZE tracked the leaders in the run down the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Ostracize
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Stay Fantastic
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, closed rail, held

ENTRY.NAME: Shotgun Rider
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, pressed 2w, rallied 2w, closed 2w, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Fort Langley
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Family Biz
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 6 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Maiden Optional Claiming Purse 20000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000, if for $45,000, allowed 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $57,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOLA M rushed to the lead while securing the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, and widened her advantage late to prove best. ARUNDEL CASTLE away well and was allowed to settle off the early pace while saving ground entering the first turn, awaited racing rom midway down the backstretch, rallied smartly two wide from between rivals through the final turn, and closed willingly one out from the rail in the drive to get up for the place. CHI CHI'S SONG away alertly and tracked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, and finished willingly from along the rail in the drive and just failed to hold the place. MATSQUI stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, got shuffled back to trail the field into the final turn while racing three wide, and finished two out from the rail in the drive while unable to make a serious late impact. B C CHRISTIE was off a step slow and trailed the field into the first turn while racing two out from the rail, advanced three wide soon after entering the backstretch, loomed a danger three wide entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong while unable to sustain her bid. The rider of B C CHRISTIE lost his whip leaving the final turn. SWANGIN broke sharply, but steadied sharply when put in tight quarters at the rail passing the wire the first time, held a tracking trip two wide in the run down the backstretch, rallied three wide through the final turn, steadied from between rivals leaving the turn, and had little left for the drive. Following the running of this race there was a rider's claim of foul, the rider of SWANGIN lodged a claim of foul against the rider of LOLA M, for alleged interference passing the wire the first time. After review the claim of foul was disallowed, and no change was made to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: B C Christie
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, trailed, advanced 3/8, rallied 3w, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Swangin
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, steadied early, tracked 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Chi Chi's Song
ENTRY.OWNER: Forster Stable and Blue Willow Dairy Ltd
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Arundel Castle
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson Lyle Johnson Mark V and Harding Clive
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled inside, waited 3/8, rallied 2w, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Matsqui
ENTRY.OWNER: Renfrew Racing B and B Racing No Trump Stable Elder Matt and Breen Bill
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Lola M
ENTRY.OWNER: Nite and Day Stable Todd Joanne and S and D Holdings
ENTRY.COMMENT: led rail, rallied inside, clear lead, widened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 4 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Si nce April 3 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KOALA away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, opened a clear advantage in the run to the final turn, and widened her advantage through the final furlong under confident handling. ANIMA broke sharply and stalked the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backside, commenced her bid from along the rail entering the final turn, and closed willingly two wide in the drive to hold on for the place. BAKZONE stalked the early pace at the back of a compact field entering the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed determinedly from along the rail in the drive to garner a share. HARLAN'S ANGEL was sent hard in the run to the first turn to press the pace from the outside of KOALA, held a tracking trip two wide in the run down the backstretch, continued to chase the pacesetter two wide into the final turn, but was outfinished in the late going. KANDY KATIE stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, dropped back to trail midway through the final turn, and had little to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Anima
ENTRY.OWNER: Bulldog Bros Racing and LeMasurier Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked rail, rallied rail, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Koala
ENTRY.OWNER: Forster Stable and Ace in The Hole Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, clear lead, widened

ENTRY.NAME: Harlan's Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 2w, tracked 2w, rallied 2w, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Kandy Katie
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Bakzone
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4 wide, rallied inside, closed rail

RACE.RACE_TEXT: George Royal S. HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 94. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. By subscription of $100 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday, May 27, 2023 with an additional $750 to enter and $1,000 to start. $50,000 guaranteed, of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth, and 2% to sixth through eighth, finishers nineth through eleventh will receive their starter fee back. Three Year Olds: 120 lbs. Older: 124 lbs. Fillies & Mares allowed 5 lbs. Non-winners of $55,000 in 2022-2023 allowed,3 lbs. Non-winners of $27,500 in 2022-2023 allowed 5 lbs. Non-winners of $12,000 in 2022-2023 allowed 7 lbs. Preference will be based on total earnings in 2022-2023 as recorded by Equibase at time of entry. Field limited to 11 starters. (Max. weight all lowance to 115lbs.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BIG UNION broke sharply and was allowed to settle off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, tipped three wide to launch his bid entering the final turn, took control leaving the turn, and drew clear in the drive under confident handling. SOARINGFORTHESUN unhurried early while dropping back to trail, rallied one out from the rail from between rivals through the final turn, and finished two out from the rail in the drive to prove second best. BAKKEN OVERDRIVE away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace while racing two wide in the run down the backstretch, held his advantage into the final turn, was overtaken leaving the turn, and finished for wide in the drive to garner a share. CASCADE BILLY tracked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground along the inside, rallied smartly two wide entering the final turn, and finished evenly five wide in the drive. SET TO SHINE settled off the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. BE QUICK away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of BAKKEN OVERDRIVE entering the first turn, dropped into a tracking trip one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Big Union
ENTRY.OWNER: Rycroft Cathy Rycroft Kelly Dale Dennis Perry Tabitha and Benson Sheryle
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled rail, rallied 3 wide, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Bakken Overdrive
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, led, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Cascade Billy
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Set to Shine
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Soaringforthesun
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Be Quick
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 w, tracked 2w, rallied inside, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Emerald Downs S. HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 92. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR FILLIES & MARES THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. By subscription of $100 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday, May 27, 2023 with an additional $750 to enter and $1,000 to start. $50,000 guaranteed, of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to secon d, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth, and 2% to sixth through eighth, finishers nineth through eleventh will receive their starter fee back. Three Year Olds: 120 lbs. Older: 124 lbs. Non-winners of $55,000 in 2022-2023 allowed, 3 lbs. Non-winn ers of $27,500 in 2022-2023 allowed 5 lbs. Non-winners of $12,000 in 2022-2023 allowed 7 lbs. Preference will be based on total earnings in 2022-2023 as recorded by Equibase at time of entry. Field limited to 11 starters. (Max. weight allowance to 115l bs.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WE B THREE stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied smartly two wide through the final turn, slipped through along the rail entering the lane, and quickly assumed command and drew clear late. REA MEA broke sharply and raced to a narrow lead while racing out from the rail entering the backstretch, set a pressured pace into the final turn, was overtaken soon after straightening for home, but battled gamely three wide in the drive to hold the place. BAYAKOAS IMAGE away well and pressed the pace from the outside of REA MEA in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide through the final turn, and finished determinedly four wide in the drive to garner a share. RUN LOLA RUN tracked the leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished five wide in the drive. SOLARITY stalked the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, steadied when put in tight quarters at the rail midway down the backstretch, rallied along the inside through the final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive, but was unable to overcome her earlier troubled trip. SHAMRA settled well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished five wide in the drive while unable to make a late impact. WANDALITA away alertly, but was allowed to settle well off the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but failed to make a late impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Bayakoas Image
ENTRY.OWNER: Nite and Day Stable and Todd, Joanne
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, pressed 2w, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Run Lola Run
ENTRY.OWNER: Gilbert George Gilbert Donna Potozny Larry and Godart Maria
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Shamra
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Wandalita
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Rea Mea
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: We B Three
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2w, rallied 2w, closed rail, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Solarity
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, steadied 3/8, rallied inside, closed rail

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $6,250 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 3 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 3 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000. For Three Year Old Claiming $12,000 (BC Bred $15,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COUNTRY COWBOY broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the backstretch, set a pressured pace from the inside of SLOOP JOHN B in the run down the backside and through the final turn, took control leaving the turn and quickly drew clear to prove best. DEPUTY'S DANCER broke outwards in the opening strides while bumping with JERSEYS IMAGE, tracked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive to prove second best. TEX TONIC broke inwards while bumping and crowding horses to his inside, before settling off the contested early pace, rallied two wide through the final turn, and finished one out from the rail in the drive to garner a share. SLOOP JOHN B away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of COUNTRY COWBOY entering the first turn, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, was unable to keep tabs on his pace rival leaving the turn, and was outfinished late. TRAPALIS was squeezed soon after the start, and forced to settle well off the early pacesetters entering the backstretch, saved ground through the final turn, and was unable to make a serious late impact while finishing three wide in the drive. ONE FIFTY ONE unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. SILARONE was bumped and squeezed soon after the start, and dropped well off the contested early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but failed to make a late impact. JERSEYS IMAGE was bumped and pushed out in the opening strides, and raced five wide into the backstretch to gain a stalking trip, dropped back in the run to the final turn, and faded over the final furlong. Following the race the stewards conducted a review of the start and run away from the gate. After review there was no change made to the original order of finish

ENTRY.NAME: One Fifty One
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Country Cowboy
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied inside, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Sloop John B
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Deputy's Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke outwards, tracked 3w, rallied 3w, closed 3w, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Jerseys Image
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, stalked 5 wide, rallied 4 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Trapalis
ENTRY.COMMENT: squeezed, settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Silarone
ENTRY.COMMENT: squeezed, settled rail, rallied inside, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Tex Tonic
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke inwards, settled 2 w, rallied 2w, closed 2 wide,
